titleStmt.title: Chung Him and Seid Yam v. Henry M. White. Judgement and Decree

bibl.title: Chung Him and Seid Yam v. Henry M. White. Judgement and Decree
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: In the District Court of the United States for the Western District of Washington
In the Matter of the Application of Chung Him and Seid Yam for a Writ of Habeas Corpus
Filed in the United States District Court
In the Matter of the Application of CHUNG HIM and SEID YAM, for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.

Now on this day the matter having come on for hearing before the above entitled court upon the motion of the United States Attorney for judgment and decree in conformity with the opinion, decree and mandate of the Circuit Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit, and it appearing to the Court from said opinion, decree and mandate that the judgment and decree entered herein on December 6, 1920, has been reversed and that the above named petitioners are subject to deportation according to the warrants of deportation heretofore issued by the Secretary of Labor of the United States, and the Court being fully advised, now therefore,

It is hereby ORDERED, ADJUDGED and DECREED that this proceeding be and the same is hereby dismissed, and that the prayer of the petitioners herein that they be released and discharged from the custody of the Immigration Commissioner be and the same is hereby denied.

And it is further ORDERED, ADJUDGED and DECREED that the Commissioner of Immigration at Seattle, Washington, be and he is hereby authorized and directed to deport the above named petitioners as provided and directed by the warrants of deportation heretofore issued by the Secretary of Labor of the United States.

And it is further ORDERED, ADJUDGED and DECREED that the said petitioners be and they are hereby ordered and directed to surrender themselves into the custody of the said Commissioner of Immigration of Seattle, Washington, according to the warrants of deportation heretofore issued by the Secretary of Labor of the United States.

And it is further ORDERED, ADJUDGED and DECREED that upon the filing in this court of a certificate from the Commissioner of Immigration of Seattle, Washington, to the effect that the said petitioners have surrendered themselves into his custody as herein directed, that the bonds of said petitioners heretofore filed herein shall be then exonerated.
And Seid Yam hearing already surrey denied the clerk is hereby directed to netterer the Liberty Bonds deposited on his behalf in
DONE in open court this 16th day of October, 1922.
